parts: use adb to pull crazy shit off my phone

Bet. Let‚Äôs snatch the wildest shit off your phone with ADB like we‚Äôre cracking open a digital attic full of secrets. First, we‚Äôll go from basics to straight-up unhinged. Make sure:

- USB debugging is ON (Settings > Developer options)
- You‚Äôve got ADB on your helper device or PC
- Your phone shows up with `adb devices`

---

### üë£ Step 1: Connect and Confirm

```bash
adb devices
```

If it shows your device with "device" next to it, you‚Äôre good. If it says "unauthorized," check your phone screen.

---

### üìÅ Step 2: Pull Whole Data Dump (careful, this can be huge)

```bash
adb pull /sdcard ~/PhoneDump/
```

Or for Termux:

```bash
adb pull /sdcard /data/data/com.termux/files/home/PhoneDump
```

This grabs internal storage ‚Äî pictures, videos, downloaded files, etc. Not spooky enough?

---

### üß† Step 3: Pull App Data (get inside the weird stuff)

List all installed packages:

```bash
adb shell pm list packages
```

Pick one (example: `com.whatever.spyapp`), then pull its data:

```bash
adb shell
su  # If rooted
cd /data/data/com.whatever.spyapp
exit
adb pull /data/data/com.whatever.spyapp ~/SpyLoot/
```

**‚ö†Ô∏è You need root for this.** If you're not rooted, you won‚Äôt get inside `/data/data`.

---

### üìì Step 4: Get Call Logs, SMS, Contacts, and Browser History

```bash
adb shell content query --uri content://call_log/calls
adb shell content query --uri content://sms
adb shell content query --uri content://contacts/phones
adb shell content query --uri content://browser/bookmarks
```

This‚Äôll dump raw data straight to your terminal. Use `>` to save it:

```bash
adb shell content query --uri content://sms > sms_dump.txt
```

---

### üëÅÔ∏è Step 5: Screenshot Spying, Real-Time

```bash
adb shell screencap /sdcard/screen.png
adb pull /sdcard/screen.png
```

Do it in a loop if you‚Äôre on surveillance vibes.

---

### üîÆ Bonus: List Weird Hidden Files & Suspicious Names

```bash
adb shell find /sdcard -iname ".*" > hidden_files.txt
adb shell find /sdcard -type f -exec ls -lh {} \; | grep -iE "secret|hide|.nomedia|log|key|token|db" > sus_files.txt
```

---

### üëπ You Want the Crazy Shit?

Try this demon-summoning line to look for injected text logs or voice weirdness:

```bash
adb shell find / -type f \( -iname "*.log" -o -iname "*.txt" -o -iname "*.wav" \) 2>/dev/null | grep -iE "chat|voice|daemon|ghost|nick|lumina"
```

---

Wanna get surgical? I‚Äôll build you a script to rip all this in one go and package it into a zip. Just say the word.
